questions.question: Here is your new blanket. Put it ................................ in the closet.
questions.description: To put something away is to put it in the dresser or closet.

questions.question: Once you have finished playing with your toys, put them ...................
questions.description: To put something back is to return it to the location it came from.

questions.question: My brother is a bully. He tries to put me ...................... every time I open my mouth.
questions.description: To put someone down is to criticize them or humiliate them.

questions.question: The dog was terminally ill. So we decided to put him ....................
questions.description: To put an animal down is to kill it to end its suffering.

questions.question: If you don't mind, I would like to put ........................... a suggestion.
questions.description: To put a suggestion forward is to offer it for consideration.

questions.question: If you keep putting .................... that assignment, you will never finish it.
questions.description: To put something off is to delay doing it.

questions.question: His rude manners really put me .....................
questions.description: When something puts you off, it makes you repulsed or disgusted.

questions.question: You won the first prize! No way - you are putting me ...................
questions.description: To put somebody on is to trick them.

questions.question: Please put ...................... your coat. I am taking you to the doctor.
questions.description: To put on clothes is to wear them.

questions.question: Much of the building had already been destroyed before the firemen managed to put ..................... the fire.
questions.description: To put out fire is to extinguish it.

questions.question: Will it be alright if I arrive a little early? I am asking this because I do not want to put you ................ in any way.
questions.description: To put somebody out is to inconvenience them.

questions.question: Can you put me ........................ to the manager, please?
questions.description: To put someone through to somebody is to connect them to that person.
